SRP.Q: Which category does the leftmost axis represent in this sankey chart?
Which category does the rightmost axis represent in this sankey chart?

VPR.Q: Which pair of nodes shows the largest flow in this sankey chart?
VPR.A: The largest flow is between {Emergency Care} and {Full Recovery}.

VPR.Q: Which pair of nodes shows the smallest flow in this sankey chart?
VPR.A: The smallest flow is between {Therapy} and {Worsened Condition}.

VE.A: The flow value from the node Stable Condition to the node Pregnant Women is {418}.

VE.Q: What is the flow value from the node Full Recovery to the node Seniors?
VE.A: The flow value from the node Full Recovery to the node Seniors is {1111}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value from the node Stable Condition to the next stage in the sankey chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value from the node Stable Condition to the next stage is {786}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value from the node Deceased to the next stage in the sankey chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value from the node Deceased to the next stage is {264}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from node Full Recovery?
SC.A: The total flow output from node Full Recovery is {5125}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by node Adults?
SC.A: The total flow input by node Adults is {3432}.

NF.Q: In the column Outcomes of the sankey chart, which nodes have an outflow exceeded 1270? Please list the node labels and their corresponding outflow values.
NF.A: {Full Recovery} has an outflow of {1652}, {Full Recovery} has an outflow of {1430}.

NF.Q: Between which pairs of nodes in column Patient Demographics and column Medical Specialties is the flow between 1396 and 1423? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {1397} from node {Seniors} to {Dermatology}, a flow of {1396} from node {Adults} to {Dermatology}.

NF.Q: In the sankey chart, which links have a flow between 850 and 942? Please list the source node, target node, and their corresponding flow values.
NF.A: There is a flow of {932} from node {Full Recovery} to {Children}, a flow of {850} from node {Improved Condition} to {Pregnant Women}, a flow of {850} from node {Deceased} to {Children}, a flow of {873} from node {Deceased} to {Pregnant Women}.

NC.Q: Between the flows from node Full Recovery to node Adults and from node Therapy to node Worsened Condition, which path has a larger flow?
NC.A: The flow from node {Full Recovery} to node {Adults} is larger.

NC.Q: Among the flows from node Worsened Condition to node Seniors, from node Stable Condition to node Pregnant Women, and from node Emergency Care to node Full Recovery, which path has the largest flow?
NC.A: The flow from node {Emergency Care} to node {Full Recovery} is the largest.

NC.Q: Among the flows from node Preventive Care to node Worsened Condition, from node Improved Condition to node Pregnant Women, and from node Emergency Care to node Deceased, which path has the largest flow?
NC.A: The flow from node {Emergency Care} to node {Deceased} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which node in the column Treatment Types of the sankey chart is the most critical?
MSR.A: The most critical node in the column Treatment Types is {Emergency Care}.

MSR.Q: What is the path with the highest total flow from source node Emergency Care to target node Pediatrics? Please list all node labels along this path.
MSR.A: The path with the highest total flow from node Emergency Care to node Pediatrics is: {Emergency Care, Full Recovery, Adults, Pediatrics}.
